intro: Pisonia lauterbachii, commonly known as the Lauterbach's pisonia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pendulous flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous small seeds. Pisonia lauterbachii is often found in coastal areas and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils.
